Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: PFK52
Reviews.Content: This AKA is very conveniently located for me. Very near Grand Central for subway access. Even though they have no restaurant or room service, the area has many good restaurants, diners, and groceries with prepared foods. The staff is very nice and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient, good service”
Reviews.Author: Cannotpacklight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three weeks, proved to be a fabulous base for work and play. The staff are good, friendly and helpful. Great to have the gym, wifi, coffee and muffins in the morning, perfect to grab on the way out the door. Good food marts just around the corner and great to have the well-equipped kitchen. Separate living and bedroom was so welcome, and the bathroom is a good size. Heating was excellent. Wish they'd have servicing of the suite more often than weekly, but that being said, there was never a problem with asking for fresh towels or toiletries, at the door within five minutes. We'll stay here again next year, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Splishsplash
Reviews.Content: When looking for a place to stay with a six month old, was looking for a place with a kitchen and also a separate bedroom - AKA UN did not disappoint. Not really a traditional 'hotel' but made up for it in other ways; Room = spacious and well equipped, perfect with a young child Service = really well looked after throughout whole stay - cib provided immediately with no prior notice, always on hand to open doors with a pram Food = although there is not a restaurant there was plenty of menus for local eateries that delivered to the door, perfect for us to be able to have a leisurely meal after babe was asleep Location = Really very convenient to everything in NYC, which suprised us as it looks much further away from things on a map! Price = incredible value for money after staying in the more traditional hotels this really is extremely good value Overall will definitely be staying here again next time in NYC whether for a few days for a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Your Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: STEPDI
Reviews.Content: Having been on assignment in NYC from the UK, the AKA UN became my home away from home for the last 5 months. The apartments offer great comfort and are very clean and spacious – much better than staying in a normal hotel room and exceeding other serviced apartments that I have seen in the City. You get all the hotel services like 24-hour front desk, gym, great business centre and lovely garden plus tope bathroom and kitchen amenities etc. Weekly cleaning is sufficient and towels and bed linen is changed at the same time. Great Molton Brown bathroom products. No disturbance from delivery trucks during the night either, which for NYC is a plus and overall noise levels for NYC very acceptable. Great location as you can walk everywhere within minutes, very safe neighborhood. The staff is outstanding. Barbara as the General Manager leads from the front and does an outstanding job, supported by an excellent team. I cannot recommend this place enough – its fantastic. If you are looking for a medium to long-term stay and want to feel at home – this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch luxury at an unbelievable price in NY City”
Reviews.Author: Kleetampa
Reviews.Content: This extended stay property offers huge, luxurious rooms at prices that are difficult to find in NY City, even for the usual tiny, dingy room. I booked a one week stay, 5 nights for business and 2 nights at the end for pleasure. The room & proeprty was exactly as nice as pictured on the web site. The one bedroom suite was the size of my condo at home, and is HUGE by typical New York City hotel standards. There was a king sized bed, full-sized stainless steel kitchen appliances, granite countertops in the kitchen, a living room, hardwood floors, a bathroom with marble walls and shower enclosure, a full bathtub, and tons of closet space. The room was only on the 6th floor, but the one-way street was relativey quiet for sleeping, compared to many NYC streets. My living room even had a balcony! The staff was excellent, very friendly, and extremely accomodating with tips on tourist attractions, nearby restaurants, nearby stores, etc. It rained one morning and the doorman gave me an umbrella to use for the day. Although it was a luxury accomodation, the staff was very helpful and understanding of my budget when I asked questions concerning items I was paying for personally. Maid service takes place only once (mid-week) during a week-long stay, but there were plenty of clean towels and other supplies, and the desk is willing to supply anything needed in between. My only criticism was that my clean sheets after the midweek change had some hair on them, likely either from the cleaning staff or whoever did the laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Nice Room!”
Reviews.Author: ibzsupernova
Reviews.Content: I love everything about AKA United Nations. The hotel is kept well and in modern deco. Room is very comfy, clean and well equipped. This was definitely a five star experience! The room is huge! The staff is friendly and the location is great! Very highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly staff!! Very helpful!!”
Reviews.Author: mtyrrell
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in NYC! The staff at A.K.A made it even more enjoyable. Very friendly and knew a lot about the area. Suggested great restaurants and places to go!! At the end of the night always staff always asked where we went and how we liked it. The rooms are nice. Fairly clean, but not like home. I consider myself a hotel snob and can be very critical, however I would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Construction Work, Service Okay”
Reviews.Author: JPolisi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKA United Nations while visting New York. The location was convenient and the facilities clean and adequate. However, the place was next to a construction site and we were woken up at 7AM every morning (including weekends) to the noise of heavy drilling and other construction work. Traffic noise (honks from taxis and garbage trucks) was bad every night (even till 2AM in the morning!). Our friends stayed at one of the rooms facing away from the main road and said that noise was slightly better. However, her room was right next to an old office building with workers looking in to her room all day and did not get enough light. Service was so-so. The in-room internet service was slow and had been inaccessible on few occassions (during the evenings).

Reviews.Title: “Better known as AKA United Nations”
Reviews.Author: ManxQueenies
Reviews.Content: A fantastic find... Booked AKA UN for 5 nights for a Spring trip - we were going to stay at the Marriott Residences to get the advantage of a kitchen - but for the same price as a studio there we booked a one bedroom apartment here - and appeared to be a much better buy. Position not immediately central - but only 5 min walk from Grand Central Terminus, or UN the other way. You could hear the traffic on 3rd ave - but only if you left the windows open. AKA is in a residential side street. Reception and doorman always friendly. The apartment was spotless with everything you wanted - well equipped kitchen, comfortable bedroom and lounge. Bathroom a little small - but good shower. Services every day - only minor criticism was that dishwasher powder not replaced daily. Light breakfast served in morning by reception and coffee available all day. There was a 24/7 corner shop - but a better bet was the supermarket just up 2nd avenue a few mins walk - this was also near the Manchester pub (a good English style pub - good beer and food ok), and next door to that a great Chinese restaurant and take away. Overall - a great visit to NYC and I'll certainly return - also have AKA at the right place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention soon”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkWendy
Reviews.Content: I bought a package at the United Nations property on LuxuryLink.com and was disappointed after having stayed at seven other LuxuryLink hotels. This extended stay facility isn't a true hotel and doesn't have the level of maintenance that a hotel would have. The floors are peeling, the drapes dirty, the linen rough and scratchy. It does have much more space and a kitchen that a hotel room wouldn't have. The decor is serviceable although getting a bit worn. For what I paid, I felt it was OK but if I'd paid their standard rates, I would have been quite upset.And the drunk guy singing in the halls one night didn't help! Security isn't sufficient to handle a situation like that. Staff is friendly and tries but quite young and inexperienced. Housekeeping wasn't quick to clean when we requested it, the phone and the air conditioning weren't working properly in our unit. All in all, I won't be back and others should be aware that this isn't up to a hotel standard.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious apartments, very handy to UN”
Reviews.Author: Nga_Mihi
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: Spacious, modern and very luxurious apartments POSITIVES â€¢Semi-furnished apartment (full kitchen, fridge/ freezer, coffee machine, separate lounge area, huge comfy bed, separate balcony, TV, stereo, DVD player, TV in bedroom) â€¢Super modern dÃ©cor and furnishings â€¢Very friendly staff â€¢Quiet rooms â€¢Loads of thick bath towels, face cloths etcâ€¦ â€¢Very convenient to the UN Headquarters (only 1 and 1/2 blocks away) â€¢Complimentary broadband internet access (non-wireless) â€¢Complimentary breakfast at hotel cafÃ© downstairs (weekdays only) â€¢Complimentary fancy hotel chocolates in rooms on arrival â€¢Complimentary access to 24 hr modern gym (located near lobby) â€¢Nice large air conditioning units in bedroom and lounge area ROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT â€¢Room rate a bit on the expensive side â€¢No washing machine or dryer in apartments â€¢Hotel should consider getting wireless internet (even more modest hotels in NY have wireless access available in all rooms) â€¢Additional lighting is required in rooms especially bedroom OTHER â€¢Close to corner store and beer and wine store (few mins walk from the hotel) â€¢Taxi fare to JFK airport from hotel is approx $35 USD I stayed here for x2 nights from 18 - 20 May 2006

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible. No service. Furniture was in very poor condition. Noisy location. Door lock was very loose. Would never stay there again

HotelInfo.Name: AKA United Nations
HotelInfo.Address: 234 E 46th St, btwn 2nd & 3rd Aves, New York City, NY 10017
